useCase.name: Loss of Signal
useCase.description: Without an onboard pilot, there is a significant reliance on the command and control link, and a greater emphasis on the loss of functionality associated with lost of signal. This exception case occurs when such a loss of signal occurs. Most UAVs have some degree of onboard autonomy - varying between the ability to continue flight to the currently assigned waypoint, execute failsafe mechanisms, and/or complete an entire mission autonomously.

preconditions.precondition: The UAV is in the air and has a command and control link to one or more ground control stations.
A [failsafe] action has been established to activate RTL (Return to Launch) at a predefined altitude in case of loss-of-signal.

successEndConditions.condition: Signal is re-established and the flight continues.
The UAV is landed safely despite the loss of signal.
The UAV completes its mission autonomously despite loss of signal (currently not authorized by FAA).

failureEndConditions.condition: The UAV is lost and/or crashes.

useCase.trigger: The UAV is in flight and experiences a loss-of-signal event for greater than [loss_of_signal_threshold_seconds].

mainSequence.step: The UAV detects and responds to loss-of-signal.
The UAV detects that it has lost communication with the ground control station.
The failsafe mechanism is activated, and the UAV autonomously returns to launch (RTL) at its designated RTL altitude.
DroneResponse responds to the loss-of-signal event.
The runtime monitoring system detects the loss of signal event for the UAV.
The runtime monitoring system raises an alert.
The alert is displayed in the UI to notify the RPIC of the loss-of-signal event.
The RPIC maintains visual line of sight with the UAV and observes that it has transitioned to RTL mode.
If necessary, the UAV suspends the remainder of its mission or moves other UAVs out of the way of the returning UAV.

esteps.description: No failsafe mechanism has been established onboard the UAV.
esteps.step: If the UAV flies outside an established Geofence, the Geofence_failsafe is activated.

esteps.description: Multiple UAVs experience a simultaneous loss of signal and activate RTL simultaneously.
esteps.step: Each UAV has a unique altitude assigned and returns home safely, avoiding collisions during RTL (optimistic scenario).
Each UAV does not have a unique altitude assigned, increasing the risk of collisions during simultaneous RTL events.
ATC runs a diagnostic of each UAV's flight path and attempts to reserve airspace for the entire RTL route.
When airspace cannot be reserved for the entire route, the UAV reserves airspace for as much of the route as available. The UAV mode is reset to FLYING.
When the UAV reaches an intermediate waypoint, it attempts to reserve airspace for the remainder of the flight.
Steps 4.2 and 4.3 are repeated until the UAV receives clearance to return home.
